Game

Class Score

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Score

  • public class Score
extends java.lang.Object
    The Score class contains the static functions that are able to calculate scores after a game of Go.
    Author:
    luuk.bosch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Score() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int getAmountofStones(Board board, int color)
      Counts the amount of stones of a specific color on a specific board.
      static int getAreaScore(Board board)
      Checks for all the empty areas on the board if they are surrounded by a single color.
      static int getScore(Board board, int color)
      To calculate the score for a specific color the amount of stones and the captured areas are needed.
      static void removeStones(Board board, int color)
      Removes the stones of a specific color from the board.
      static void setEmptytoNumber(Board board)
      Sets all the empty field with a empty marker creating groups of empty intersections.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getAreaScore

        public static int getAreaScore(Board board)
        Checks for all the empty areas on the board if they are surrounded by a single color. If this is the case the size of this captured area is added to the score. returns the total score.
        Parameters:
        board -
        Returns:
